comments: Professor Leatherman is a great professor. He really cares about the students and made the class interesting. It was a summer course so we had 2 tests, and 3 papers. I would take more psych courses with him because I actually learned material through discussion and lecture.

He is one of the best professor at Lehman College. He is understanding and goes out of his way to help students achieve good grades, not only in his class but in other classes. I recommend him, you will learn so much with him,

Great class! Very interesting subject. This professor really cares about his students and teaching. He even gave us a lecture on how to write and lit review. Big help! He also went out of his way to make time to answer questions, check articles and read lit review rough drafts. He coaches his students. Very positive. Excellent professor.

I really enjoy this subject so I read the book. His class style is very laid back. He doesn`t put slides on BB so you may want to take pix of them. Exams are fair, he tells you whats going to be on there but he will make you work. A lit review is due, as well as a structured interview and 3 exams. He gave extra credit. Highly recommend Leatherman

Give 3 exams, one paper and one project. The class is enjoyable, but don\'t be fooled, the test is hard. Attendance is not mandatory, but it will help you pass the tests. He\'s tough on the paper, so put effort...but flexible and will take it late if you have a good reason for delay. Very understanding and just a nice guy all around!!

He is easy as long you do all the assignment his tests are easy becasue on the exam he usually tells you what chapter the question is from and he will give you the review. He doesnt care about attendance because all his work is online.I just loved him. Also he was very understanding and caring.

Best nicest teacher in QC- you dont need to go to class, tho i did. He wants to help his students as much as possible and even gives an e.c report that can add 15 points. Test are fine- you need to study but he posts the slides and the text is not so boring- i got an A+ with not working so hard- and the final was open notes... TAKE THIS CLASS!

Class is not mandatory. Tests are easy, mostly based off of slides and are not cumulative. Final was open notes. The course itself seemed a bit boring at times but Professor Leatherman is an absolute stitch. The man\'s hilarious and makes the class interesting. He\'s also very nice, very easy to talk to, and explains the material very well.

Professor Leatherman is awesome! He teaches off his slides and posts them online for the class to have too. He is very clear, tells you exactly what will be on the exams, and is straight-forward and fair. Take this class!!
Exams were very easy and he allowed us to do extra credit assignments, but he is sooo boring! Very nice guy, though.

he is an OK teacher. i dont think i got to much out of it. class was a drag, bring a computer. attendence not mand. just take 4 tests. his tests arent the easiest but you can pass. if you want to learn and be interested maybe not such agood class for you, if you dont care and dont mine doing everything on your own then take it

The person who said they did everything they could and could still not pass must have an IQ od 1. His tests are not hard at all. You do have to study, at least a little. I never went to class and i got an A-. I did study, but i didnt kill myself over it. Study his notes on blackboard and you\'ll get a good grade.
this is not a good class. I would not rec. him. no curve or anything so if you do bad its your fault. big lecture waiste of time you will not get anythng out

He\'s really so easy I dont know what anyone else is saying... first of all if u never come to class u can still do well. his slides are straight from the publisher of the book so its likely that no new info will be given during class thats not in the book. book is so dumb. tests EASY e/o same form, gives answers!!!! TAKE HIM HES SO NICEEEE
Do not take. Horrible professor. Exams are impossible to pass. You will fail. Guaranteed.

4 multiple choice exams(50-75 questions)20 points extra credit for doing articles related to business and attendance not mandatory.Final replaces another lower grade-counts 2x. His notes are all you need for the exams.Powerpoint slides on blackboard.He relates everything to hsi experiences as a business executive in a top law firm in New York City.
